venice.lib.parser

Class SlotEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • venice.lib.AbstractSlot
      • venice.lib.parser.SlotEvent

  • public class SlotEvent
extends AbstractSlot
    Holds a data item with value, sensor name, data type and timestamp. This class is mainly used to communicate data between a large number of venice components and with the application. It is unrelated to any specific network protocol, that is the reason why the slot of the event is handled as a String instead as an instance of an actual slot class (such as InSlot from InstantIO, or Informer from RSB).

        time - the timestamp of the event

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this event. The format is
        '{label}' of {type}, timed for {time}, value: {value}

        If there is no label, {label} will be just an empty string.

        The {type} will be the java class name or "unknown type", if type is null.

        {time} is the String representation of the timestamp.

        {value} is the String representation of the value. If the value is an array, then each element of the array will be turned into a String representation, with the format defined by java.util.Arrays.

        This method is used mainly as part of error messages or for debugging. It is in no way meant to parse events. To parse events into Strings use XIOParser.

        Overrides:
        toString in class AbstractSlot
        Returns:
        Returns a string representation of this sensor.
